message.content:
Ipomoea pes-caprae, also known as beach morning glory or goat's foot, is a species of flowering plant in the morning glory family.
It is a creeping vine that can grow up to 6 meters in length and forms dense mats on sandy beaches.
The leaves are thick and fleshy, heart-shaped and arrow-headed, with a dark green color on the upper side and a silver-gray color on the undersides.
The flowers are trumpet-shaped, pink or purple in color, and bloom in the morning before closing in the afternoon.
This plant is commonly found along tropical and subtropical coastlines around the world, particularly in sandy and salty habitats.
It has a high tolerance for salt and sand, and is often used in beach stabilization projects.
Ipomoea pes-caprae is also used in traditional medicine to treat a variety of ailments such as fever, inflammation, and skin infections.
